attributes.action: Extend the Brexit transition period by the maximum possible period of two years
attributes.additional_details: Under the terms of the Withdrawal Agreement, the Brexit transition period can be extended for up to two years if a request is made before June 30 this year.  The government should do the right thing and apply for the maximum 2 year extension before June 30th.  We need to work together with the EU to beat COVID-19 and not isolate ourselves as a society and nation.
attributes.background: The British public are currently having to deal with the awful human and economic consequences of the COVID-19 Global pandemic.  We don't want a potential no deal brexit outcome compounding our problems on December 31st.  Government should focus entirely on fighting COVID 19.
